letters of request
procedure to be followed

bankruptcy act 1966 (cth), s. 29. in december 1979 ayres was declared bankrupt in new zealand and his estate vested in the official assignee. ayres had not been declared bankrupt in australia but he had certain property here, namely an interest as sole residuary beneficiary under the will of his late father. creditors in new zealand had, at the date of this application, proved for the sum of $78,248; his assets in new zealand had realized almost $50,000. more than sixty per cent of the proved creditors were revenue authorities in new zealand, being the inland revenue department, new zealand post office and new zealand department of customs.  pursuant to letters of request the high court of new zealand sought the aid of the federal court to enable the official assignee to obtain control of the bankrupt's property in australia. the federal court directed service of notice of this application on the bankrupt.  held: (1) it is a well-established principle of public policy that the courts in australia will not enforce the revenue laws of another country.
